description_txt: stated on November 20, 2012 in a post on Facebook:
quote_txt: A precinct in the Allen West-Patrick Murphy recount has "7 registered voters in Guatemalan community and the tally showed 900 voted!!!!!"

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2012 in a proposed ordinance.:
quote_txt: Says the initial Portland plastic bag ban represented "only a modest share of total single-use checkout bag use."

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2012 in a website:
quote_txt: "In 2011, our state-run lottery funded New Jersey classrooms by over $930 million."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2012 in a petition on the White House website:
quote_txt: "In one county alone in Ohio, President Obama received 106,258 votes. But there were only 98,213 eligible voters."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2012 in an email:
quote_txt: "Secular Americans are the fastest-growing religious identification demographic in this country."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2012 in an interview on NBC Nightly News:
quote_txt: Says New Jersey is "50th in return of our federal tax dollars."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2012 in an open letter to employees.:
quote_txt: Says that under the new healthcare law, full- and part-time workers will be required to buy insurance costing $375 to $1,000 a month, starting in 2014.

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2012 in in a news release announcing support for the Sportsmen's bill.:
quote_txt: "More Tennesseans have hunting and fishing licenses than vote."

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2012 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Three thousand felons voted in Rhode Island in 2008.

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2012 in an interview on the Daily Rundown on MSNBC.:
quote_txt: Says New Hampshire had the fourth-lowest unemployment rate in the country during Maggie Hassan’s time in the state Senate.

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2012 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: Says the Multnomah County Library system "is the second busiest in the nation."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2012 in an opinion column in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: Says 40 years ago, the U.S. placed Texas under Voting Rights Act for failing to print ballots in Spanish.

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Barack Obama is "only the second Democrat in the last 75 years to win Ohio twice with more than 50 percent of the vote."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2012 in an online post:
quote_txt: "There is no reason to allocate 60 percent of bridge space to satisfy two percent of all travelers."

description_txt: stated on October 23, 2012 in an email to employees:
quote_txt: Says that with President Obama's re-election, state and federal income tax rates for some taxpayers will rise "to roughly 65 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2012 in an interview with NJTV's Michael Aron for "On The Record":
quote_txt: "Every American now is $51,000 in debt. That’s money I owe, that’s money my children owe before they even go to kindergarten, that’s their check to the federal government right now."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2012 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: Budget analysts say the looming tax hikes and spending cuts would  "take us into a recession and kill jobs."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2012 in a Texas Tribune interview.:
quote_txt: Says the state of Texas rates as "unacceptable" almost 500 of the state's 8,000 public schools.

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: When it comes to income taxes, Wisconsin is "one of the best places in the country to be poor" but "top 4 or 5 worst" for middle-income earners.

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2012 in an op-ed on the Asbury Park Press' website:
quote_txt: "Sixty percent of New Jersey doctors do not accept Medicaid patients."

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Says a poll shows that "without a name attached, Democrats are just one point behind" Gov. John Kasich.

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2012 in a web post:
quote_txt: "Clayton County offers the lowest operating millage rate in Metro Atlanta."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2012 in a newspaper article :
quote_txt: Half the lottery directors across the country had not run a lottery before they were hired.

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2012 in a campaign rally:
quote_txt: Says under President Barack Obama, the United States has created "five million jobs."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2012 in an election flier :
quote_txt: Says Mike Dovilla supports a plan "that could allow a foreign corporation to take over the Ohio Turnpike" 

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in a League of Women Voters guide for Texas and Austin voters:
quote_txt: Says that over the past 20 years, Texas public school spending rose 142 percent and per-pupil spending more than tripled when adjusted for inflation.

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Revenues are 15 percent of GDP — it’s still in the range of the lowest it’s ever been."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2012 in a radio address:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin still ranks first among the 50 states in manufacturing jobs per capita."

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2012 in a press conference :
quote_txt: Says "I was the first governor in America to endorse Mitt Romney."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2012 in an article for Time magazine.:
quote_txt: Says Tennessee’s higher education funding model "is 100 percent outcomes-based" and "we are already seeing this model changing the way our postsecondary institutions do business."
